column4: what does this line means? cd /usr/src cd kernel-source-version cp /boot/config-uname --kernel-release ./.config
it is in the kernelhowto but I dont understand it
it's several commands on one line - that won't work
it is in the kernelhowto, but dont understand the --kernel-release ./.config
uname --kernel-release get you a kernel version
so the cp command becomes something like cp /boot/config-2.6.xxx ./.config
you can do uname --kernel-release and reuse the output to pu ttogether the command
./.config is the destination file (hidden config in current directory)
how can I use the make kpkg "--append-to-version".  The --append-to-version, how do I type that?
because the kernelhowto says it has to be used, but gives no examples
